summary: This bill, the Welles Remy Crowther Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a Congressional Gold Medal posthumously to Welles Remy Crowther in recognition of his bravery, heroism, and sacrifice during the September 11th attacks. The bill outlines the presentation process, design of the medal, its disposition, and the authorization to produce and sell bronze duplicates. It highlights Crowther's actions in rescuing others from the World Trade Center and his embodiment of heroic virtues.
